books.title: The Playboy of the Western World
books.author: J. M. Synge
books.summary: A young man in the west coast of Ireland is lionized after he claims to have killed his father.

books.title: Pimpernel and Rosemary
books.author: Baroness Orczy
books.summary: A famous journalist is drawn into the intrigues of two Eastern European nations in the aftermath of World War I.

books.title: A Daughter of the Samurai
books.author: Etsu Inagaki Sugimoto
books.summary: The autobiography of Etsu Sugimoto, a girl born into a samurai family in a time of great cultural changes.

books.title: Tombstone
books.author: Walter Noble Burns
books.summary: An embellished retelling of the town of Tombstone, Arizona, during its heyday in the late 19th century, featuring famous heroes and outlaws of the American Old West.

books.title: The Wonderful Adventures of Nils
books.author: Selma Lagerlöf
books.summary: Nils Holgersson, transformed to an elf, learns the meaning of kindness during his adventures with a flock of wild geese.

books.title: Penguin Island
books.author: Anatole France
books.summary: A myopic saint mistakenly baptizes some penguins, ushering in a centuries-spanning satire of French history.

books.title: Candida
books.author: George Bernard Shaw
books.summary: A clergyman’s beliefs about his respectable household are challenged by a young poet who is in love with his wife.

books.title: Khaled
books.author: F. Marion Crawford
books.summary: A powerful genie is condemned to live the life of a man, unless he can find true love.

books.title: The Beasts of Tarzan
books.author: Edgar Rice Burroughs
books.summary: An old enemy kidnaps Tarzan’s family, and Tarzan must rescue them with the help of his panther and ape friends.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Edgar Allan Poe
books.summary: A collection of Edgar Allan Poe’s short fiction, ordered by date of publication.

books.title: Scrambles Amongst the Alps in the Years 1860–69
books.author: Edward Whymper
books.summary: A classic in early mountaineering literature, describing the first ascent of the Matterhorn and other climbs in the Alps.

books.title: The Dain Curse
books.author: Dashiell Hammett
books.summary: A detective assigned to investigate a diamond theft finds himself entangled by a family curse.

books.title: Representative Men
books.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
books.summary: A collection of seven lectures by Ralph Waldo Emerson on great men and their role in society.

books.title: The Social Contract
books.author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau
books.summary: Rousseau explores the political philosophy of authority originating from the consent of the people.

books.title: New Hampshire
books.author: Robert Frost
books.summary: Robert Frost’s Pulitzer-winning book of poetry.

books.title: Where Angels Fear to Tread
books.author: E. M. Forster
books.summary: After an English widow on holiday impetuously falls in love with a handsome young Tuscan, her panicked in-laws send a rescue party.

books.title: The Food of the Gods
books.author: H. G. Wells
books.summary: Two scientists discover a substance which promotes rapid and extreme growth in plants, animals, and humans, leading to unexpected and alarming consequences.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Philip K. Dick
books.summary: A collection of short works by science fiction legend Philip K. Dick.

books.title: Polynesian Mythology
books.author: George Grey
books.summary: A collection of Māori mythology covering the start of the universe through to the spread of Māori tribes through New Zealand’s North Island.

books.title: To Cuba and Back
books.author: Richard Henry Dana Jr.
books.summary: A captivating travel memoir recounting an 1859 journey to Cuba, offering vivid descriptions of the island’s culture, landscapes, and people.
